question: Why the Core inflation is considered to be a better indicator than the headline inflation?
option1: Core Inflation includes certain items that are subject to sudden and short-lived price movements
option2: Core Inflation excludes certain items that are subject to sudden and short-lived price movements
option3: Core inflation has a wider basket of items
option4: Headline Inflation has a wider basket of items
answer: Core Inflation excludes certain items that are subject to sudden and short-lived price movements
explanation: Core Inflation is the rate of inflation calculated to exclude certain items that are subject to sudden and short-lived price movements, mainly food and energy. Core inflation is considered a better indicator of overall long-term than un-adjusted headline inflation.
